member.name: IMFSourceResolver.BeginCreateObjectFromByteStream
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous request to create a media source from a byte stream.
member.param: A pointer to the byte stream's interface.
A null-terminated string that contains the original URL of the byte stream. This parameter can be NULL.
A bitwise OR of one or more flags. See Source Resolver Flags.

A pointer to the IPropertyStore interface of a property store. The method passes the property store to the byte-stream handler. The byte-stream handler can use the property store to configure the media source. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Configuring a Media Source.

Receives an IUnknown pointer or the value NULL. If the value is not NULL, you can cancel the asynchronous operation by passing this pointer to the method. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL.
A pointer to the interface of a callback object. The caller must implement this interface.

A pointer to the IUnknown interface of a state object, defined by the caller. This parameter can be NULL. You can use this object to hold state information. The object is returned to the caller when the callback is invoked.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The dwFlags parameter contains mutually exclusive flags.
The byte stream is not supported.
The byte stream does not support seeking.

member.name: IMFSourceResolver.BeginCreateObjectFromURL
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous request to create a media source or a byte stream from a URL.
member.param: Null-terminated string that contains the URL to resolve.
Bitwise OR of flags. See Source Resolver Flags.

Pointer to the IPropertyStore interface of a property store. The method passes the property store to the scheme handler or byte-stream handler that creates the object. The handler can use the property store to configure the object. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Configuring a Media Source.

Receives an IUnknown pointer or the value NULL. If the value is not NULL, you can cancel the asynchronous operation by passing this pointer to the method. The caller must release the interface. This parameter can be NULL.
Pointer to the interface of a callback object. The caller must implement this interface.

Pointer to the IUnknown interface of a state object, defined by the caller. This parameter can be NULL. You can use this object to hold state information. The object is returned to the caller when the callback is invoked.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The dwFlags parameter contains mutually exclusive flags.
The URL scheme is not supported.

member.name: IMFSourceResolver.CancelObjectCreation
member.summary: Cancels an asynchronous request to create an object.
member.param: Pointer to the IUnknown interface that was returned in the ppIUnknownCancelCookie parameter of the or method.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFSourceResolver.CreateObjectFromByteStream
member.summary: Creates a media source from a byte stream. This method is synchronous.
member.param: Pointer to the byte stream's interface.
Null-terminated string that contains the URL of the byte stream. The URL is optional and can be NULL. See Remarks for more information.
Bitwise OR of flags. See Source Resolver Flags.

Pointer to the IPropertyStore interface of a property store. The method passes the property store to the byte-stream handler. The byte-stream handler can use the property store to configure the media source. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Configuring a Media Source.
Receives a member of the enumeration, specifying the type of object that was created.
Receives a pointer to the media source's IUnknown interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The dwFlags parameter contains mutually exclusive flags.
This byte stream is not supported.

member.name: IMFSourceResolver.CreateObjectFromURL
member.summary: Creates a media source or a byte stream from a URL. This method is synchronous.
member.param: Null-terminated string that contains the URL to resolve.
Bitwise OR of one or more flags. See Source Resolver Flags. See remarks below.

Pointer to the IPropertyStore interface of a property store. The method passes the property store to the scheme handler or byte-stream handler that creates the object. The handler can use the property store to configure the object. This parameter can be NULL. For more information, see Configuring a Media Source.
Receives a member of the enumeration, specifying the type of object that was created.
Receives a pointer to the object's IUnknown interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The dwFlags parameter contains mutually exclusive flags.
The URL scheme is not supported.

member.name: IMFSourceResolver.EndCreateObjectFromByteStream
member.summary: Completes an asynchronous request to create a media source from a byte stream.
member.param: Pointer to the interface. Pass in the same pointer that your callback object received in the method.
Receives a member of the enumeration, specifying the type of object that was created.
Receives a pointer to the media source's IUnknown interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSourceResolver.EndCreateObjectFromURL
member.summary: Completes an asynchronous request to create an object from a URL.
member.param: Pointer to the interface. Pass in the same pointer that your callback object received in the method.
Receives a member of the enumeration, specifying the type of object that was created.
Receives a pointer to the media source's IUnknown interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFSourceResolver
member.summary: Creates a media source from a URL or a byte stream. The Source Resolver implements this interface. To create the source resolver, call function.
